snippet: Nicolás Maduro, the newly elected president, and his opponent, Henrique Capriles Radonski, blamed each other for the violence that has killed at least seven people.
abstract: Tensions escalate in Venezuela as newly elected Pres Nicolas Maduro and his opponent Henrique Capriles Radonski blame each other for violence that government says has left seven people dead; Maduro accuses United States of being behind opposition protests.

byline.contributor: Paula Ramón and María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting from Caracas, and María Iguarán from Cumaná, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: Nicolás Maduro, the newly elected president, and his opponent, Henrique Capriles Radonski, blamed each other for the violence that has killed at least seven people.

headline.seo: Post-Election Tensions Rise in Venezuela Amid Deadly Protests
headline.main: Post-Election Tensions Escalate in Venezuela as Demonstrations Turn Deadly
headline.print_headline: Post-Election Tensions Escalate in Venezuela as Demonstrations Turn Deadly
